review_title: Really enjoyed working with community members
pros: You get to provide a worthy service to local people. English skills are essential to get by in the US, especially in the northeast.
cons: You have to work on Saturday.

review_title: Touts equity and people first but does not deliver
pros: Small community, employees get to know each other across divisions. Decent physical working spaces, general camaraderie at the staff level.
cons: No form of parental leave. Inflexible vacation and sick leave benefits. No raises, underpaid and overworked. Staff not replaced after attrition and more additional duties are required in addition to maintaining missing staff responsibilities. No room for advancement.

pros: Supportive supervisor, diverse group of people
cons: The amount of work, lack of growth

pros: There's work flexibility depending on the type of job you have
cons:
Does not practice diversity and inclusion if you're not senior staff.
They say they want to have pay equity by make attempts to justify lower pay.
Way too much work for little pay.
Promote people to higher positions that are not experts in the field.

pros: Great benefits, lovely office, wonderful students.
cons: Stress-fueled work environment at expense of employee well-being.

review_title: Strong, committed community with limited resources
pros: Strong sense of community and commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion. Dynamic, creative and talented students.
cons: Limited financial resources and staffing to support needs. Often feels like more of a private high school environment than a competitive academic institution.

pros: I have had a lot of flexibility in my work schedule as long as core hours are met. Particularly during covid, management has been extremely flexible. It's small college so you get to know everyone.
cons: Salaries and department staffing are not great, particularly in IT, but true for all staff departments. That leads to stress and overwork.

job_title: Prefer Not To Say in Baltimore, MD
pros: Beautiful campus, caring staff and amazing students.
cons: Stagnant growth; low wages, and high turnover.

pros: Numerous techniques learned throughout three years of both dry and went biology/chemistry/physics courses
cons: Online platforms are not very helpful for science related coursework/jobs

job_title: Goucher Library Assistant in Baltimore, MD
pros: My boss was a great mentor
cons: The pay was minimum wage

pros: She is very understanding as long as you are transparent with her.
cons: Making rounds at night with a partner so it can be inconvinient

job_title: Residential Life Coordinator in Towson, MD
pros: The students were okay, I guess
cons: Residential Life = Toxic work environment, long hours, had to go to the hospital with every student, no support from supervisor, passive aggressive work environment chalk full of favoritism, micro aggressions, and unprofessional behavior.

review_title: A hard job, worth it in the end
job_title: Residential Assistant in Athens, Athens, Attica
pros: The RA community is pretty great, I've know so much more about campus and so many more people that I did before. The pay (the price of a single room) is decent. Some residents are lovely. Training is a great way to learn a lot about Goucher's staff and campus resources. Training also, of course, trains you how to do your job satisfactorily. There's plenty of opportunity to learn on the job though.
cons: It's super stressful. You live in a fishbowl (in that everywhere you go, what you do reflects on your job) and people have very high expectations about your ablities to help them. Doing rounds of the campus is exhausting and occasionally frightening so luckily it's only 10-ish times a semester. Constant staffing changes are part of the nature of ResLife, but make unsteady ground for RAs in need of assistance or advice at times. Some residents are bullies or perpetrators of violence or assaults, which makes dealing with them difficult. Enforcing rules is not a great feeling. Friends may treat you differently, at least at first. There's a lot of paperwork. Training is mind-numbing at times, just exhausting at others.

job_title: Operations Manager in Athens, Athens, Attica
pros: Location location of the highway
cons: Low pay scale for positions

pros: Has good training and helpful staff
cons: The pay could be better

review_title: Great community, Goucher College loves their quirky students
job_title: Program Assistant In the Office of International Studies in Athens, Athens, Attica
pros: You get the feel of a small school and campus, but great, top-notch resources.  Staff is really friendly and many of them are alums, so they are super passionate about the students.  Also, the location is a dream, right in Towson, close to the city, and the Beltway is right there, really easy to get to, even with public transportation.  It's the best of both worlds!
cons: It's academia, so if you're more of a business/startup type of person, you'll get bored after a while, like I did.  That said, I would have loved to stay in a different role, but the initial position I came in under was part time, and there wasn't room for growth, despite performance.  But that is often the case at universities.

pros: Beautiful campus grounds, likeable staff and faculty. Average benefits and weekly pay. I learned a great deal navigating office politics by simply just being employed here. There is an overall understanding of leadership idosyncracies which naturally allowed easy bonds to be form with all employees.
cons: Although pay is weekly, it isn't considerable. Raises are scarce, time off has to be accumulated over long periods of time. Many supervisory staff members are cliquish and have subtle qualities that can be interpereted as racism. Lot of room for growth.

pros: Goucher still has strong academics and dedicated professors. As a staff person I felt that my efforts were appreciated and I was promoted accordingly. It was a pleasure to work with my team.
cons: There is little ROI for students, and low retention. President cuts budgets, but adds VPs. Wages stagnate. Morale suffers. Services suffer, Retention, student and staff, suffers. Arbitrary and uninformed decisions from senior staff.

review_title: Overall it's been good, but budget cuts have prevented us from receiving raises for several years.
pros: The people are really enthusiastic and willing to help. There's also a lot of training provided by HR, the employee association, and the technology department. My boss has also been great about allowing me to attend conferences and seminars.
cons: Some of the senior managers seem out of touch and the budget cuts have been tough.

review_title: Clueless leadership, lack of understanding of current higher Ed environment
pros:
Decent benefits
Attractive campus, though so full of empty offices it's hilarious that ft staff has to camp out in abandoned buildings
cons: Unfriendly leadership, inability to see forest for trees, insane politics and back stabbing, in the dark ages when it comes to marketing.

job_title: Writing Center Tutor in Towson, MD
pros: Rewarding work, easy access to job location
cons: Poor pay, unreliability of many coworkers

review_title: I'd be surprised if it's still open in 10 years......
pros: Good salary- lots of paid time off
cons: everything else. Departments are always trying to push off jobs. HR is always trying to write up and fire people for no reason. One day you see someone and the next...gone. No job security unless you are a professor. Then you can teach one mediocre class and get paid big bucks.

job_title: Public Safety Officer in Baltimore, MD
pros: Great benefits and compensation, small very diverse  community, many opportunities for advancement and education paid tuition for you and you children after 2 years employed.
cons: I have no complaints it's a good place to work.

job_title: Student Leader for Civic Action in Towson, MD
pros: Supportive co workers and great boss. Lots of growth opportunity and you really get to know your community. Flexible hours and team
cons: Managing school work and working with different community partners can be overwhelming and because there are so many programs sometimes supervisor had trouble responding

job_title: Community Living Coordinator in Baltimore, MD
pros: Excellent professional staff and lots of great students. Lots of room to be involved in lots of things
cons: Lower end of the pay scale- limited room for advancement. Being involved in lots of things does not mean a great work life balance sometimes.

pros:
-Commitment to trying new programs and initiatives- innovation and adaptability
-Commitment to diversity and inclusion, and real conversations about privilege
cons:
-Limited access to resources, opportunities for advancement, and promotion 
-Liberal Arts focus which is challenging in the current higher education marketplace

pros: Small community of supportive and dedicated staff. Most people go above and beyond in their work, and working with others in this environment makes my job gratifying.
cons: Employees are leaving, everyone does two jobs. New hires are entry-level. Services suffer, staff are demoralized. College is borrowing money & raising new buildings while shrinking departments and resources. Low salaries.

pros: I was a part-time lecturer in the Communication & Media Studies Department.  I love Goucher, and the faculty and students are wonderful.
cons: It was a short-term position, as I was filling in for a professor on medical leave.

pros: Flexibility, resources, location, easy to navigate physically and administratively, friendly people,
cons: Low pay relative to cost of living in this area, lacks racial and economic diversity,

review_title: Wish I Had Been There Longer
pros: The campus and facilities are lovely and you are treated with respect as an important member of the community.
cons: There are not many positions available.

pros: A lot of the people in charge of student workers
cons: Quite a few people who shouldn't be in charge of other people at this institution.

pros: Positive, supportive community of coworkers/peers; flexible hours
cons: Low pay, despite paying tuition to get qualified for job

pros: Strong support for individuality and work-life balance
cons: Long orientation process, many workshops and training programs for workplace safety and inclusivity

pros: Great benefits, Management listens.  Friendly staff
cons: Sometimes worked long hours. Pay was low.

review_title: Goucher does care, to an extent.
pros: Goucher College has a friendly staff culture. The facilities are wonderful.
cons: There are a lot of social politics.

review_title: Great place to work. Great environment.
job_title: Public Safety Officer in Towson, MD
pros: Supportive community. Great benefits. Educational opportunities.
cons: None that I can think of

pros: Easy to get an on campus job
cons: None I can think of

pros: Flexibility, Good administration and program
cons: The salary per class is underpaid
